# Comprehensive Test Cases for Sunday.com
*Generated by QA Engineer - Building on Existing Test Foundation*

## Test Case Classification

**Priority Levels:**
- ğŸ”´ P0: Critical (blocking issues)
- ğŸŸ¡ P1: High (important functionality)
- ğŸŸ¢ P2: Medium (standard features)
- ğŸ”µ P3: Low (nice-to-have)

**Test Types:**
- **Unit:** Individual component testing
- **Integration:** Component interaction testing
- **E2E:** End-to-end user workflow testing
- **Performance:** Load and response time testing
- **Security:** Vulnerability and access control testing

---

## ğŸ”´ P0 Critical Test Cases (Must Pass for Release)

### TC-001: User Authentication Flow (E2E)
**Priority:** ğŸ”´ P0
**Type:** E2E
**Feature:** Authentication
**Test Case:** User can register, login, and access protected resources

**Prerequisites:**
- Clean database state
- Application running on test environment

**Test Steps:**
1. Navigate to registration page
2. Enter valid user details (email, password, name)
3. Submit registration form
4. Verify confirmation message
5. Navigate to login page
6. Enter registered credentials
7. Submit login form
8. Verify redirect to dashboard
9. Verify user information displayed correctly
10. Access protected route (e.g., /boards)
11. Verify authorization works

**Expected Results:**
- Registration succeeds with valid data
- Login redirects to dashboard
- User info displays correctly
- Protected routes accessible after login

**Test Data:**
```json
{
  "email": "testuser@example.com",
  "password": "TestPassword123!",
  "firstName": "Test",
  "lastName": "User"
}
```

**Automation:** âœ… Extend existing login.test.ts

---

### TC-002: Board Creation and Management (E2E)
**Priority:** ğŸ”´ P0
**Type:** E2E
**Feature:** Core Board Functionality
**Test Case:** User can create, view, and manage boards

**Prerequisites:**
- User logged in
- Workspace available

**Test Steps:**
1. Navigate to boards page
2. Click "Create New Board"
3. Fill board creation form
4. Submit board creation
5. Verify board appears in list
6. Click on created board
7. Verify board details page loads
8. Add a new column to board
9. Create a new item in column
10. Update item status
11. Verify real-time updates

**Expected Results:**
- Board creation form validates correctly
- Board saves and appears in list
- Board details page displays correctly
- Columns can be added/modified
- Items can be created and updated

**Critical Issue:** âš ï¸ Board detail page shows "Coming Soon" - THIS BLOCKS RELEASE

**Automation:** âŒ Not possible until BoardPage is implemented

---

### TC-003: Task/Item CRUD Operations (Integration)
**Priority:** ğŸ”´ P0
**Type:** Integration
**Feature:** Task Management
**Test Case:** Complete item lifecycle management

**API Endpoints Tested:**
- POST /api/items
- GET /api/items/:id
- PUT /api/items/:id
- DELETE /api/items/:id

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **Create Item**
   - Valid item creation
   - Invalid data rejection
   - Required field validation

2. **Read Item**
   - Get item by ID
   - Get items by board
   - Non-existent item handling

3. **Update Item**
   - Status changes
   - Field updates
   - Concurrent update handling

4. **Delete Item**
   - Soft delete functionality
   - Permission validation
   - Cascade operations

**Test Data:**
```json
{
  "name": "Test Task",
  "description": "Test task description",
  "boardId": "board-123",
  "status": "todo",
  "priority": "medium",
  "assigneeId": "user-123"
}
```

**Automation:** âœ… Extend existing item.service.test.ts

---

### TC-004: Real-time Collaboration (Integration)
**Priority:** ğŸ”´ P0
**Type:** Integration
**Feature:** WebSocket Communication
**Test Case:** Multi-user real-time updates

**Test Steps:**
1. Open board in two browser windows (different users)
2. User 1 creates new item
3. Verify User 2 sees item immediately
4. User 2 updates item status
5. Verify User 1 sees status change
6. User 1 adds comment
7. Verify User 2 sees comment
8. Test with network interruption
9. Verify reconnection and sync

**Expected Results:**
- Changes appear in real-time (<2 seconds)
- No data loss during reconnection
- Conflict resolution works correctly
- User presence indicators function

**Critical Issue:** âš ï¸ Real-time features not connected to UI

**Automation:** âœ… Extend websocket.service.test.ts

---

### TC-005: Data Persistence and Integrity (Integration)
**Priority:** ğŸ”´ P0
**Type:** Integration
**Feature:** Database Operations
**Test Case:** Data consistency across operations

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **Transaction Rollback**
   - Failed board creation doesn't leave orphaned data
   - Failed user registration cleanup

2. **Foreign Key Constraints**
   - Cannot delete workspace with boards
   - Cannot delete user with active assignments

3. **Data Validation**
   - Email uniqueness enforced
   - Required fields validated
   - Data type constraints respected

**Expected Results:**
- No orphaned records created
- Foreign key constraints enforced
- Data validation prevents corruption

**Automation:** âš ï¸ Needs new test file: database.integration.test.ts

---

## ğŸŸ¡ P1 High Priority Test Cases

### TC-006: Permission and Authorization (Security)
**Priority:** ğŸŸ¡ P1
**Type:** Security
**Feature:** Access Control
**Test Case:** Role-based access control validation

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **Workspace Access Control**
   - Members can access workspace
   - Non-members cannot access workspace
   - Admin can manage members
   - Regular members cannot manage members

2. **Board Access Control**
   - Board members can view/edit board
   - Non-members cannot access private boards
   - Permission inheritance from workspace

3. **API Security**
   - Invalid JWT rejected
   - Expired tokens handled
   - SQL injection prevention
   - XSS protection

**Test Data:**
```json
{
  "adminUser": {"id": "admin-1", "role": "admin"},
  "memberUser": {"id": "member-1", "role": "member"},
  "outsiderUser": {"id": "outsider-1", "role": null}
}
```

**Automation:** âš ï¸ Needs new test file: security.test.ts

---

### TC-007: API Performance Testing (Performance)
**Priority:** ğŸŸ¡ P1
**Type:** Performance
**Feature:** API Response Times
**Test Case:** API endpoints meet performance requirements

**Performance Requirements:**
- API response time < 200ms (95th percentile)
- Database queries < 100ms
- File upload < 5 seconds (10MB files)

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **Load Testing**
   - 100 concurrent users
   - 500 concurrent users
   - 1000 concurrent users

2. **Stress Testing**
   - Gradual load increase
   - Spike testing
   - Resource exhaustion

3. **Volume Testing**
   - Boards with 10,000+ items
   - Large file uploads
   - Complex queries

**Tools:** k6, Artillery, or custom Node.js scripts

**Automation:** âŒ Needs new performance test suite

---

**Priority:** ğŸŸ¡ P1
**Type:** Integration

**Test Scenarios:**

   - ItemForm validation works

2. **State Management**
   - Zustand stores update correctly
   - State persistence across navigation
   - Optimistic updates work

3. **API Integration**
   - Loading states display
   - Error handling shows messages
   - Success feedback works

**Automation:** âœ… Extend existing component tests

## ğŸŸ¢ P2 Medium Priority Test Cases

### TC-009: Search and Filtering (Functional)
**Priority:** ğŸŸ¢ P2
**Type:** Functional
**Feature:** Search Functionality
**Test Case:** Users can search and filter content

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **Board Search**
   - Search by board name
   - Filter by workspace
   - Sort by creation date/update date

2. **Item Search**
   - Search by item name/description
   - Filter by status, priority, assignee
   - Advanced search combinations

3. **Search Performance**
   - Large dataset search (<500ms)
   - Autocomplete suggestions
   - Search result pagination

**Automation:** âš ï¸ Depends on search implementation

### TC-010: File Upload and Management (Functional)
**Priority:** ğŸŸ¢ P2
**Type:** Functional
**Feature:** File Attachments
**Test Case:** File upload and management functionality

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **File Upload**
   - Various file types (images, documents, archives)
   - File size limits (up to 100MB)
   - Multiple file upload
   - Upload progress indication

2. **File Management**
   - File preview functionality
   - File download
   - File deletion
   - File permissions

3. **File Security**
   - Virus scanning
   - File type validation
   - Access control

**Test Data:**
- Small files (< 1MB): images, text documents
- Medium files (1-10MB): presentations, PDFs
- Large files (10-100MB): videos, archives

**Automation:** âœ… Extend existing file.routes.test.ts

**Priority:** ğŸŸ¢ P2
**Type:** Functional
**Feature:** Notifications
**Test Case:** Users receive appropriate notifications

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **Real-time Notifications**

   - Comment mentions (@username)
   - Status change notifications
   - Due date reminders

2. **Notification Preferences**
   - Email notification settings
   - In-app notification settings
   - Notification frequency controls

3. **Notification Delivery**
   - In-app notification display
   - Email notification sending
   - Push notification (if mobile)

## ğŸ”µ P3 Low Priority Test Cases

### TC-012: Accessibility Testing (Accessibility)
**Priority:** ğŸ”µ P3
**Type:** Accessibility
**Feature:** WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance
**Test Case:** Application meets accessibility standards

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **Keyboard Navigation**
   - Tab order logical
   - All interactive elements reachable
   - Escape key functionality

2. **Screen Reader Compatibility**
   - ARIA labels present
   - Form labels associated
   - Error messages announced

3. **Visual Accessibility**
   - Color contrast ratios meet standards
   - Text scalability (up to 200%)
   - Focus indicators visible

**Tools:** jest-axe, Lighthouse CI, manual testing

**Automation:** âš ï¸ Needs axe-core integration

---

**Priority:** ğŸ”µ P3
**Type:** Compatibility
**Feature:** Mobile Experience
**Test Case:** Application works on mobile devices

**Test Scenarios:**
1. **Responsive Design**
   - Layout adapts to screen sizes
   - Touch-friendly interface
   - Mobile-specific features

2. **Performance on Mobile**
   - Page load times acceptable
   - Smooth scrolling and interactions
   - Offline capability (if implemented)

3. **Cross-Device Testing**
   - iOS Safari
   - Android Chrome
   - Various screen sizes

**Tools:** Browser developer tools, real device testing

**Automation:** âš ï¸ Needs mobile testing setup

**Supported Browsers:**

- Edge (latest 2 versions)

2. **UI/UX Consistency**
   - Layout renders correctly
   - Animations work smoothly
   - Form interactions consistent

## Test Data Management

### Test Data Categories

#### User Data
```json
{
  "validUsers": [
    {"email": "admin@test.com", "role": "admin"},
    {"email": "member@test.com", "role": "member"},
    {"email": "viewer@test.com", "role": "viewer"}
  ],
  "invalidUsers": [
    {"email": "invalid-email", "password": "weak"},
    {"email": "", "password": ""},
    {"email": "test@test.com", "password": "123"}
  ]
}
```

#### Board Data
```json
{
  "validBoards": [
    {"name": "Project Alpha", "type": "kanban"},
    {"name": "Marketing Campaign", "type": "table"},
    {"name": "Bug Tracking", "type": "list"}
  ],
  "boardColumns": [
    {"name": "To Do", "type": "status"},
    {"name": "In Progress", "type": "status"},
    {"name": "Done", "type": "status"}
  ]
}
```

#### Item Data
```json
{
  "validItems": [
    {"title": "Sample Task", "priority": "high", "status": "todo"},
    {"title": "Bug Fix", "priority": "urgent", "status": "in_progress"},
    {"title": "Documentation", "priority": "low", "status": "done"}
  ]
}
```

### Test Environment Setup

#### Database Seeding
- Create test users with known credentials
- Set up sample workspaces and boards
- Generate test items with various statuses
- Create permission scenarios

#### Test Cleanup
- Automated cleanup after test runs
- Isolated test data (no production contamination)
- Consistent test state between runs

---

## Automation Strategy

### Test Pyramid Distribution
- **Unit Tests (60%):** âœ… Well covered
- **Integration Tests (30%):** âœ… Good coverage
- **E2E Tests (10%):** âš ï¸ Needs expansion

### CI/CD Integration
```yaml
# GitHub Actions example
test:
  runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  steps:
    - name: Run Unit Tests
      run: npm run test
    - name: Run Integration Tests
      run: npm run test:integration
    - name: Run E2E Tests
      run: npm run test:e2e
    - name: Generate Coverage Report
      run: npm run coverage
```

### Test Execution Matrix
- **Every Commit:** Unit tests
- **Feature Branch:** Integration tests
- **Staging Deploy:** E2E tests
- **Release Candidate:** Full test suite + performance

---

## Quality Gates

### Release Readiness Checklist
- [ ] All P0 tests passing
- [ ] 80%+ unit test coverage
- [ ] All API endpoints tested
- [ ] Critical user journeys validated
- [ ] Performance requirements met
- [ ] Security tests passing
- [ ] No critical accessibility issues

### Test Success Criteria
- **Pass Rate:** 95%+ for automated tests
- **Coverage:** 80%+ line coverage
- **Performance:** API < 200ms, UI < 2s
- **Security:** No critical vulnerabilities
- **Accessibility:** WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
